verses.text: 但以理再見異象伯沙撒王在位第三年，在先前顯給我的異象之後，再有一個異象向我但以理顯現。

words.note: A supernatural vision or revelation.
A supernatural vision or revelation.
A supernatural vision or revelation.
To become visible or manifest.

verses.text: 我在異象中觀看，看見自己在以攔省書珊城堡裡；我在異象中繼續觀看，看見自己在烏萊河的岸邊。

words.note: A supernatural vision or revelation.
Often used as a postposition to mean 'in' or 'among'.
Often used as a postposition to mean 'inside'.
A supernatural vision or revelation.
Often used as a postposition to mean 'in' or 'among'.

verses.text: 公綿羊我舉目觀看，看見一隻公綿羊，站在河邊；牠有兩個角，兩角都很高，但高低不一；那較高的角是較遲長出來的。

words.note: Refers to a male sheep, often with thick wool.
Refers to a male sheep, often with thick wool.
Indicates something that grew out.

verses.text: 我看見那公綿羊向西、向北、向南撞去，沒有走獸能在牠面前站立得住，也沒有能拯救脫離牠手的；牠任意而行，狂妄自大。

words.note: Refers to a male sheep, often with thick wool.
Refers to wild animals.

words.definition: able to stand firm, hold up

words.note: Here 'hand' figuratively means 'power' or 'control'.
Nominalizes the preceding phrase to mean 'those who could save'.
Connects clauses, often indicating cause or manner.
A four-character idiom (chengyu) describing excessive pride.

verses.text: 公山羊我正在思考的時候，忽然有一隻公山羊從西而來，走遍全地，快得腳不沾塵；這山羊兩眼之間有一個顯眼的角。

words.definition: in the process of, just then

words.note: Connects verb '思考' to noun '時候'.
Connects clauses, often indicating consequence or manner.
Used after an adjective to introduce a result or degree.
Lit. 'obvious to the eye', catching attention.

verses.text: 牠走到我先前所看見站在河邊、那有兩個角的公綿羊那裡去，忿怒地向公綿羊猛力衝去。

words.note: Forms a nominalized clause with following verb.
Often written '憤怒' in modern Chinese.

verses.text: 我看見公山羊走近公綿羊，向牠發怒，撞擊牠，折斷牠的兩個角；公綿羊在牠面前站立不住，牠把公綿羊撞倒在地上，又用腳踐踏牠，沒有能拯救公綿羊脫離牠手的。

words.note: Here, 'hand' metaphorically means 'power' or 'control'.
Indicates a descriptive clause ending in '...the one who could...'

verses.text: 這公山羊非常狂妄自大；但在牠強盛的時候，那大角被折斷了；在大角原來的地方，有四個顯眼的角向天的四方長出來。

words.note: Indicates completion or change of state.

verses.text: 從這四個角中的一個角，又長出一個小角來，這小角向南、向東和向榮美之地，不斷強大起來。

words.note: A biblical term referring to the land of Israel.

verses.text: 牠漸漸長大，高及天象，把一些天象和星星摔落在地上，用腳踐踏。

words.note: Refers to celestial bodies or spiritual powers in biblical context.
Refers to celestial bodies or spiritual powers in biblical context.

verses.text: 牠狂妄自大，要高及天象之君；牠除掉獻給天象之君的常獻祭，又拆毀他的聖所。

words.note: Refers to celestial bodies or spiritual beings.
Classical Chinese equivalent of '的'.
Refers to the daily or continual sacrifice.

verses.text: 因罪過的緣故，聖民連同常獻的祭都交給牠；牠把真理丟在地上，任意而行，凡事順利。

words.note: Refers to the continual burnt offering.

words.definition: act as it pleases, do as it wills
words.note: A classical idiom, often used in biblical context for unrestrained action.

verses.text: 我聽見一位聖者在說話，又有一位聖者問他：「這個關於除掉常獻的祭，和引致毀壞的罪過，以及踐踏聖所和聖民的異象，要到幾時呢？」

words.note: Often used in biblical contexts to mean profaning or dishonoring.

verses.text: 他對我說：「要到二千三百個晚上和早晨，聖所才得潔淨。」
加百列解釋異象的意義我但以理看見了這異象以後，就想明白它的意義；忽然有一位外貌像人的，站在我面前。

words.definition: in front of me, before me

verses.text: 我又聽見從烏萊河兩岸之間，有人的聲音呼叫著說：「加百列啊！你要使這人明白這異象。」

words.note: 見 here acts as a complement indicating the successful completion of '聽'.
Refers to a divine or prophetic vision.

verses.text: 他就來到我所站的地方；他來到的時候，我就害怕，臉伏在地；他對我說：「人子啊，你要明白！這異象是關於末後的時期的。」

words.note: Forms a noun phrase with the following verb and noun.
A title for a human figure, often messianic in prophetic texts.
Refers to a divine or prophetic vision.
Frequently used in eschatological contexts in the Bible.

verses.text: 他和我說話的時候，我沉睡了，臉伏在地；他撫摩我，使我兩腳站起來。

words.note: Implies a deep or heavy sleep.

verses.text: 他說：「看哪！我要告訴你在 神忿怒審判的後期必要發生的事，因為這是有關那末後的定期的。

words.note: An archaic or literary interjection used to draw attention.
Refers to the singular divine being. The leading space is a traditional sign of reverence in Chinese Bibles.
Often used in biblical texts, similar to 憤怒.
Common in legal and religious contexts.
Frequently used in eschatological contexts in the Bible.

verses.text: 你所看見那有兩個角的公綿羊，就是瑪代和波斯王。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase with the following verb.
Literally 'male woolly sheep'.

verses.text: 那多毛的公山羊就是希臘王；那兩眼之間的大角就是第一個王。
至於代替那折斷了的角，在牠原來的地方長出來的四個角，就是四個要從他的國中興起的王國，只是沒有他的權勢。

words.note: Used specifically for animals.

verses.text: 「在這四國的後期，犯罪的人惡貫滿盈的時候，必有一個面貌兇惡的王興起，他詭計多端。

words.note: An idiom describing the accumulation of evil deeds.
An idiom for being very cunning or tricky.

verses.text: 他的權勢強大，卻不是出於自己的能力；他必造成驚人的毀滅；他任意而行，凡事順利；他必毀滅有強力的，又毀滅聖民。

words.definition: to act willfully, do as one pleases
words.note: An idiom describing acting without restraint.

verses.text: 他運用詭計，行騙無往而不利；他心裡狂妄自大；他必乘人不備的時候，毀滅許多人；他要起來攻擊萬君之君，最後卻非因人的手被毀滅。

words.note: An idiom meaning 'to be successful wherever one goes'.
An idiom for being excessively arrogant.
A title for God or Christ, lit. 'Lord of ten thousand lords'.
Classical Chinese 'not be'.

verses.text: 關於所說二千三百個晚上和早晨的異象是真的，但你要把這異象封住，因為那是關於將來許多的年日的。」

words.note: Literary construction, nominalizes the verb '說'
Refers to a span of time, often years.

verses.text: 我但以理精疲力竭，病了幾天，後來我起來，辦理王的事務，但我仍因這異象驚駭不已，不明白它的意思。

words.note: An idiom meaning utterly exhausted in spirit and strength.
Literally 'startled and terrified without stopping'.
